verbs.description: commercialize (third-person singular simple present commercializes, present participle commercializing, simple past and past participle commercialized)

entries.meaning: (transitive) to bring into commerce from an earlier condition (such as idea alone, experimental prototypes alone, or one-off custom builds only).
examples: the work required not only to invent a device but also to commercialize it

entries.meaning: (transitive) to apply business methodology to something in order to profit (such as introducing salability to a resource that comes from, or rightfully belongs to, the commons).
examples: finding the right balance in paying for water infrastructure (treatment plants and pipe networks) but not commercializing water to the point of excluding low-income people from adequate access to a basic necessity

entries.meaning: (transitive) to exploit something for maximum financial gain, sometimes by sacrificing quality.
examples: a market district formerly served mainly by artisans but increasingly commercialized for mass tourism
